poem:
"Island at the Mercy of Dragons"

In her heart, Taiwan stands, an island small, 
Belgium-sized heartbeat feeling China's breath;
Upon her threshold, democracy's next call,
A globe observes this dance with looming death.
Yet, hope remains, a tale not yet complete,
For screens of power hide the gentle reed,
The simple voter drawn towards the ballot sheet,
Proof that even dragons may concede.
